temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated 将想法送入你的轨道（Orbit） in the user temberature at 2022-06-05T04:55:39
item.description:
in reference to:

说某个东西「不是现在读」，那就几个月，之后是几个月之后再呈现…… 电子邮件收件箱、任务队列、个人通信等 我这些想象的核心，是每日都要练习的一种习惯，类似冥想：打开软件，完成软件呈上的微任务。

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated 将想法送入你的轨道（Orbit） in the user temberature at 2022-06-05T05:05:35
item.description:
in reference to:

记忆：重复回忆问题；时间间隔随着回答成功/失败而呈指数级扩大/缩小 过程的流畅性：重复完成简短练习，有许多变体；时间间隔随着成功/失败而呈指数级扩大/缩小 卡片写作：重复问题、模糊的想法、主干想法，从中积累思考，时间跨度为几个月；将卡片标记为「有成果」或「无成果」，以扩大/缩小时间间隔 习惯养成：重复简短的反思卡片，可能根据顺序改变，应用于你的日常经验；间隔默认扩大，但可以放缓 阅读队列：一系列 PDF，标签页，书本，总在变换：如果一段时间内忽略某些内容，它就会暂离一周，之后是一个月；比如说「我现在读够什么了」，这东西就会几天之内再次呈现；说某个东西「不是现在读」，那就几个月，之后是几个月之后再呈现…… 电子邮件收件箱、任务队列、个人通信等

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated 中医这件事 in the user temberature at 2022-06-25T14:17:45
item.description:
in reference to:

所以后来索性把医生的眼睛也蒙起来——不告诉医疗人员哪组是安慰剂组哪组是实验组，所有的结果由第三方机构去统计和评判，这就是双盲对照实验。这种测试最大限度地排除了病人的安慰剂效应和医生的主观偏好，成为了判断药物客观疗效最有力的证据，现代医学的“金标准”。

item.description:
in reference to:

With basic (BRE) syntax, these characters do not have special meaning unless prefixed (前缀) with a backslash (‘\’); While with extended (ERE) syntax it is reversed: these characters are special unless they are prefixed (前缀) with backslash (‘\’).

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated 年度征文 | 我是如何艰难地克服「效率成瘾」的？ - 少数派 in the user temberature at 2022-09-01T03:30:41
item.description:
in reference to:

对于 DEVONthink 来说，我觉得它最重要的就是 Search 搜索功能。比如说我通过 Alfred 的 DEVONthink 插件快速输入「重器轻用」，然后我就可以搜到在 DEVONthink 里面所有关于「重器轻用」的信息。而这个搜索速度是极快的，并且在右侧边栏，你可以看到搜索结果有一个展现的区域，让你快速知道哪些地方有相关文字的一个出处。

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated r/devonthink - Is DEVONthink worth it? in the user temberature at 2022-09-01T04:02:11
item.description:
in reference to:

I suppose it depends what you want to use it for. I use it for research mainly. It is excellent for document storage and analysts and it has been a game changer for me. Coupled with its ability with RSS feeds and Devon agent, I have to say it is superb. I suspect I’m only scratching the surface of its capability. It is a pretty steep learning curve but it’s capabilities are massive.Have a look at the videos on www.screencastsonline.com there is a free membership for 7 days which should give you some idea of what it is capable of. They were a great intro for me.

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated State of GPT | BRK216HFS in the user temberature at 2023-05-28T10:53:30
item.description:
in reference to:

Now, one thing to point out is base models are not assistants. (10:37) They don't want to make answers to your questions, they want to complete documents. If you tell them to write a poem about the bread and cheese, it will answer questions with more questions, it's completing what it thinks is a document. However, you can prompt them in a specific way for base models that is more likely to work.

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated State of GPT | BRK216HFS in the user temberature at 2023-05-28T10:54:05
item.description:
in reference to:

The way you would do this is you would create a specific few-shot prompt that makes it look like there's some document between the human and assistant and they're exchanging information.

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated State of GPT | BRK216HFS in the user temberature at 2023-05-28T11:01:26
item.description:
in reference to:

It has to do with the asymmetry between how easy computationally it is to compare versus generate.

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated State of GPT | BRK216HFS in the user temberature at 2023-05-28T11:08:28
item.description:
in reference to:

I think to a large extent, prompting is just making up for this cognitive difference between these two architectures like our brains here and LLM brains.

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated State of GPT | BRK216HFS in the user temberature at 2023-05-28T11:08:59
item.description:
in reference to:

These transformers need tokens to think

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated State of GPT | BRK216HFS in the user temberature at 2023-05-28T11:12:18
item.description:
in reference to:

if you don't ask it to check, its not going to check by itself it's just a token simulator.

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated State of GPT | BRK216HFS in the user temberature at 2023-05-28T11:26:46
item.description:
in reference to:

These things are pretty unstable, very difficult to train, not something that is, I think, very beginner friendly right now, and it's also potentially likely also to change pretty rapidly still.

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated State of GPT | BRK216HFS in the user temberature at 2023-05-28T11:29:35
item.description:
in reference to:

So my recommendation right now is use LLMs in low-stakes applications. Combine them always with human oversight. Use them as a source of inspiration and suggestions and think co-pilots, instead of completely autonomous agents that are just like performing a task somewhere.

make sure to add your bearer token).
